Welcome

Quick Example

>>> from prody import *
>>> pdb = parsePDB('1p38')
>>> ca = pdb.select('calpha')
>>> anm = ANM('p38 MAPK ANM')
>>> anm.buildHessian(ca)
>>> anm.calcModes()
>>> writeNMD('p38anm.nmd', anm[:6], ca)
Reads a p38 PDB structure, selects alpha carbons, and performs ANM calculations. Slowest 6 modes are written in NMD format.

ProDy is a Python package for analyzing protein structural dynamics, designed and developed by Ahmet Bakan in Bahar lab. New functional features are continually being added to ProDy. The following are the main features that have been suffessfully implemented to date:

  • Examination and analysis of structural variability observed in experiments:
    • Efficient parsing of PDB files
    • Powerful atoms selections and contact identification
    • Matching, superposing, and comparing multiple structures/chains
    • Principal component analysis (PCA) of X-ray structures
    • PCA of NMR models
  • Prediction and analysis of protein dynamics using theory and simulation:
    • Normal Mode Analysis using the Anisotropic network models (ANM)
    • Gaussian network models (GNM) analysis
    • Essential dynamics analysis (EDA) of MD snapshots
    • Comparative analysis and visualization of dynamics

For a list of features with links to examples see Feature Index.

See also our complementary software plugin NMWiz.

Get ProDy

Installation instructions and requirements can be found at Getting ProDy.

Downloads can be found in at Python Package Index: http://pypi.python.org/pypi/ProDy.

Source code can be found in at github repository: http://github.com/abakan/ProDy.
